column4: Dear ubuntu people, I want to compile something and it seems I need "scons" for that. However, the script keeps complaining it can't find "libgtkmm" in the pkg_config_path variable. How can I fix this?
install libgtkmm-dev
I tried that, it does not work :s
do you have build-essential installed?
I do according to apt-get
hmmm, if you do pkg-config --list-all in a terminal does it show libgtkmm?
it does not
did pkg-config show other libraries?
lots and lots of them so I had to use grep to filter
hmm, thats strange
no problem
any idea how I could make it show up in pkg-config?
installing the -dev for libgtkmm should make it work, what program are you trying to install?
something very exotic, its a tool to flash my ASURO robot
that is exotic, i was thinking trying to get synaptic to install the source of a similar package (which would get all of the -dev dependancies)
that'd be handy indeed ;)
it's a german company that made it though, so all packages they provide are .rpm, and heavily outdated
hmmm, this is strange, ive checked on my gentoo and it doesnt list gtkmm in pkg-config even though I do have it installed
I got through it now :). I needed libgtkmm-2.4-dev plus tweaking the gtk sourcecode a bit
good to hear :)
thanks for the helping-out though :)
